responses: All South African citizens and permanent residents can apply. For a bursary, combined household income must not exceed R350,000 per annum. For a loan, income must be between R350,000 and R600,000. Persons with disabilities must not exceed R600,000 per annum.
Returning university students who move through NSFAS academic pathways, students changing institution types, and students who dropped out and wish to resume studies must reapply.

patterns: Who cannot apply for NSFAS bursary?
responses: Students funded 100% by non-NSFAS sources, those with an existing undergraduate qualification, students studying at private institutions, or those in non-DHET/SAQA accredited courses cannot apply.

patterns: Who can apply for NSFAS loan?
responses: Students in under/post-graduate programmes with household income between R350,000 and R600,000 per annum. 70% funding goes to STEM, 30% to Humanities. A 60% pass rate is required. 70% academic performance may lead to a 50% bursary conversion.

patterns: What documents are required when applying for NSFAS?
responses: NSFAS requires personal income info and various forms: Declaration Form, Orphan and Vulnerable Child Form, Consent Form, Proof of guardianship (if applicable), and Disability Annexure Form if disabled.
